channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Planning to Graduate This December?
item.description: If you plan to graduate in December 2024 and haven’t completed your degree application yet, the Student Information System (SIS) is now open to apply! The application deadline is Friday, October 11. Please make sure you refer to the Registrar’s Graduation & Commencement webpage for complete details!
item.author: Students

item.title: Fall 2024 SoE Midterm Student Course Evaluations Now Open
item.description: Date: Thursday, October 10, 2024 (all day) - School of Engineering (SoE) midterm course evaluations are now open for the Fall 2024 semester. Your feedback is very important to the Institute and the school, so please complete the SoE midterm evaluation surveys for all your courses! Evaluations will be available through Wednesday, October 23, 2024.
item.author: Students

item.title: “Where Pride Meets Progress” Event to Feature Stories from RPI Alum
item.description: Join the Center for Career and Professional Development on October 11 at 4:00PM EST in DCC 318 for an inviting LGBTQ+ panel, where current RPI students will have an opportunity to hear from RPI alum who identify as part of the LGBTQ+ community. Panelists will join virtually and feature a diverse range of voices, representing different industries and career paths, as they share their personal and professional journeys.
item.author: Students

item.title: Free Flu Shot Clinics Available for Students October 8, 10
item.description: The Student Health Center will be offering free flu shots for RPI students from 10:00AM until 4:00PM on Tuesday, October 8 in the DCC Great Hallway, and from from 10:00AM until 4:00PM on Thursday, October 10 in the Mueller Center lobby. No appointment is necessary, so just drop by to get your free flu shot!

item.title: President’s Fall Town Meeting to be Held October 15
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 15, 2024 3:30 PM - 5:00 PM - President Martin A. Schmidt ’81, Ph.D., invites all members of the campus community to attend the Fall Town Meeting, which will be held in the Curtis R. Priem Experimental Media and Performing Arts Center (EMPAC) theater.
item.author: Community

item.title: Sikorsky Blackhawk Helicopter to Land on ’86 Field October 11
item.description: Date: Friday, October 11, 2024 8:45 AM - Don’t miss the Sikorsky Blackhawk helicopter as it lands on the ’86 Field at approximately 8:45 on the morning of Friday, October 11 as part of National Manufacturing Day! In addition to the helicopter landing, a Snap-On tools truck will also be on hand for this event.
item.author: Community

item.title: October is Cybersecurity Awareness Month!
item.description: To help all members of the campus community enhance their cybersecurity knowledge, brush up on best practices and stay informed about the latest campus cybersecurity threats, DotCIO has worked with Rensselaer’s Division of Human Resources to curate a number of training resources in Percipio.
item.author: Community

item.title: Session to Review Certificates in Analytics, Machine Learning and AI
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 15, 2024 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., for a session highlighting Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate certificate programs in Analytics, Machine Learning and AI. Attendees can expect to learn how data can inform better decisions, and will review an analytic method that can be used regardless of the tools at hand. Please register to attend.
item.author: Community

item.title: Quantum Computing Users Group Monthly Meeting Scheduled for October 16
item.description: Join students and colleagues interested in quantum computing or those currently working on the subject at noon on Wednesday, October 16 in Amos Eaton 214. If you are interested in presenting, please contact Tom Morgan.
item.author: Community

item.title: “The Other Side of Silence” Coming to EMPAC
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 7:00 PM - “The Other Side of Silence” examines technology’s role in the fabric of human society and the role it plays in promoting and diminishing our autonomy, as seen through the lens of an augmentative and alternative communication user – someone who uses a synthetic voice to communicate with the world. Through a series of interwoven storylines, this new opera explores what it means to be our true self, and which of our voices best represents our identity.
item.author: Community

item.title: Faculty Recommendations for NSF GRFP Due October 11
item.description: Date: Friday, October 11, 2024 5:00 PM - Rensselaer faculty should note that NSF GRFP is requiring letters of recommendation to be submitted early this year — by Friday, October 11 — although student applications are not due until October 15-18. Faculty members who are writing letters should have received an email from NSF with instructions on how to submit them, but may contact Betty Madigan with any questions.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Faculty/Staff Workshop to Review Supported On-Campus Whiteboarding Tools for Courses, Meetings
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - This in-person workshop will give an overview of two DotCIO-supported whiteboarding tools that are available on campus: working with the whiteboard feature in Webex, and a Box tool called Canvas. Participants will learn more about these two similar tools and consider potentially using them in their classroom or meeting space. Space for the session is limited; please register by October 11.
